Exelon<tm tmtype="reg"/> patches Patient and carer advice

Advise patients and carers of patch administration instructions, particularly to remove the previous day's patch before applying the new patch—consult product literature.
National funding/access decisions

Scottish Medicines Consortium (SMC) Decisions

The Scottish Medicines Consortium has advised (October 2007) that Exelon patches should be restricted for use in patients with moderately severe Alzheimer’s disease under the conditions of the NICE guidance (September 2007) and when a transdermal patch is an appropriate choice of formulation.
